column4: you can delete entryes in /etc/udev/rules.d/70-persistent-net.rules and reboot...it will recreate right rules and right names
I've tried that once before, but it didn't seem to work. Maybe I should try it again?
you need to delete alla entries and reboot
edbian: okay, I'm gonna try deleting the entries and rebooting, if it doesn't work I'll be back ina  few minutes. Thanks for the help!
are you sure that you are deleting alla entries?
device names depends on the drivers, i have too my wifi interface called eth1
I know, it's KERNEL value in its entry says it's for ethernet even though it successfully creates a wifi connection.
I have no problem with that tools and eth1
you need to use airmon-ng befor...get down your wifi card and restart with airmon-ng it change it in mon0 or something else
But if I type "airmon-ng" alone, the only interface is displays is eth1.
